h2.title: Why Convert BMP to ICO?
h2.description:
ICO (Icon) is the native Windows icon format and ideal for application icons and favicons:

  • Multiple Sizes: Store several resolutions in a single file.
  • Transparency: Supports alpha transparency for crisp edges.
  • System Compatibility: Works seamlessly with Windows and browsers for favicons.
  • Professional Look: Sharp icons across taskbar, desktop, and menus.

h2.title: How to Convert BMP to ICO Online
h2.description:
It only takes a few seconds:

  1. Click Upload BMP and choose your image.
  2. Wait for processing to complete.
  3. Click Download ICO to save your icon.

The tool optimizes your icon for common sizes automatically.

h2.title: ICO vs BMP: Key Differences
h2.description:
FeatureBMPICO
PurposeGeneral raster imageIcon container for apps/favicons
TransparencyNone by default; limited in some 32-bit variantsFull alpha transparency
Multiple sizesNoYes (16–256px typical)
Editing workflowSimple, uncompressed (large files)Multiple bit depths/sizes in one file

h2.title: What is BMP?
h2.description: BMP (Bitmap Image File) is a simple raster format that often stores pixels without compression, resulting in large file sizes. Great for simplicity and compatibility, but not efficient for icons or the web.

h2.title: What is ICO?
h2.description: ICO is the standard Windows icon format that can include multiple image sizes and color depths in one file, ideal for app icons and website favicons.

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: BMP (image/bmp)
  • Maximum file size: up to 16 MB per file
  • Output: ICO (.ico, MIME image/x-icon)
  • Icon sizes: 16, 32, 48, 64, 128, 256 px

h2.title: Use Cases: When to Convert BMP to ICO
h2.description:
• Favicon Creation: Generate a favicon.ico for websites.
  • Application Development: Windows apps require ICO for icons.
  • Desktop Shortcuts: Customize shortcut icons with clean edges.
  • Brand Consistency: Keep logos sharp across DPI scales.

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Upload fails: Ensure the file is BMP and ≤ 16 MB.
  • Jagged edges: Start from a higher-resolution BMP; the tool will downscale to multiple sizes.
  • Favicon not showing: Clear browser cache and place /favicon.ico at the site root with a correct <link rel='icon'>.

faq.question: Is this BMP to ICO converter free?
faq.answer: Yes, the converter is completely free with no hidden charges or subscriptions.

faq.question: Will ICO work on all operating systems?
faq.answer: ICO is primarily for Windows and favicons; macOS/Linux can display ICO but app icons there typically use other formats.

faq.question: What sizes are supported for ICO files?
What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 16 MB per file.

faq.question: Are my files safe?
faq.answer: Files are processed automatically and not retained longer than necessary for conversion.

faq.question: Can I convert multiple BMPs at once?
faq.answer: This page converts one file at a time. For bulk needs, repeat the process or use a batch tool.

faq.question: Is ICO better than BMP for icons?
faq.answer: Yes. ICO is designed for icons and can contain multiple sizes with transparency in a single file.

note: Disclaimer: ICO is best for icons and favicons. For general images, consider PNG or JPG.
